result.execSummary:
The defendant Randall T Delagarza was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Issue of Worthless Checks(<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.24(1).
  • Issue of Worthless Checks(<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.24(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Restitution to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

Costs and DNA to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain full time employment and/or school.

No contact with the Bank.
Provide DNA sample if not yet provided.
Early termination of probation if successfully completes conditions, court will then
take under advisement.

records.addlTxt: Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been satisfied.

To defendant, request denied.
From State dated 3/17/16 responding to Court's request.

filed by the State
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Randall T Delagarza in court with attorney Samuel W. Benedict.  Susan L. Opper appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Amended Information filed - reading waived.   Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1, 2 and 3.  Court finds defendant guilty.

Court orders the following: 
Ct. 1:
- Sentence withheld for  2 years Probation - concurrent to Ct. 2 and 3
- Court Costs of $253.00 (includes DRGOD) to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- Restitution of $1890.12 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- DNA Surcharge of $200.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- Conditions of  Probation: No contact with the Bank. Maintain full-time employment and/or school.  DNA Sample if not yet provided.
  30 days Condition Time STAYED to be used at the Agents discretion. Agent has discretion whether to impose huber or straight time. 

 Ct. 2:
- Sentence withheld for  2 years Probation - concurrent to Ct. 1 and 3
- Court Costs of $243.00  to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- DNA Surcharge of $200.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- Conditions of  Probation: No contact with the Bank. Maintain full-time employment and/or school.  DNA Sample if not yet provided.
  
 Ct. 3:
- Sentence withheld for  2 years Probation - concurrent to Ct. 2 and 3
- Court Costs of $243.00  to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- DNA Surcharge of $200.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- Conditions of  Probation: No contact with the Bank. Maintain full-time employment and/or school.  DNA Sample if not yet provided.
  
Defense requests early termination of Probation if successfully completes conditions. 
Court will take early termination of Probation under advisement.
Plea/sentencing hearing on January 6, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on January 6, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Randall T Delagarza in court with attorney Samuel W. Benedict.  Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense withdraws there Suppression motion. Defense states this matter has been resolved and requests another date for a plea/sentencing be scheduled. An amended Information needs to be prepared and the proper plea forms need to be completed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 6, 2015 at 10:00 am.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: Defendant Randall T Delagarza in court with attorney Samuel W. Benedict.  Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Detective Harper from the Village of Hartland was sworn and testified on behalf of the State. Cross examination by the defense. State rests. No testimony by the defense. State moves for bind over and presents arguments. Defense objects and presents arguments. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.   Bail remains as fixed.
Preliminary hearing on August 8, 2014 at 08:15 am.
Request for adjournment filed by defendant/defense counsel
Attorney Samuel Benedict for defendant.
Preliminary hearing on July 17, 2014 at 08:15 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.   Defendant to have no contact with alleged victim/witness/business listed in the Criminal Complaint. Not to possess any financial documents unless they are his own.
